ratings.comment: Great professor

Professor MacDonald really knows a lot about psycholinguistics! She tried to make the lectures enjoyable and included lots of videos. Reading the textbook and assigned readings were helpful since some test questions were specific to the readings. Interesting material and great course!

This class isn't difficult by any means; however, I hated the material and lectures were borderline painful. It had nothing to do with the Professor. She was a very very kind lady who tried making lectures enjoyable. Unfortunately, psycholinguistics is just very dry material - for me anyways. (And I'm a psych major!)

I love love loved Prof. Macdonald. She has a heart of gold and you can feel it in her lectures. If you know the lecture notes and do the readings, you will do fine on the exams. They were not terrible. The homework is a great grade booster. Take the time and go talk to her in office hours, you will be amazed at how much you learn! HIGHLY RECOMMEND.

So so so dry. Lectures are painfully slow, really feels like a waste of time and I am a type of student who usually finds lectures interesting. Everything she teaches you through the semester could be taught to you in 4 hours I kid you not. Frustrating if you like getting things done but not a lot of content.

The class has three midterms, one final, and one easy homework assingment. To pass the class just do all the readings and try to go to most of the lectures. Shes a pretty decent lecturer, but it can sometimes get dull.

Lectures were nice and well paced/explained. She is obviously very knowledgeable and passionate about psycholinguistics. Great personal stories and demos. My only gripe is she is terrible at seeing people raise their hands to ask a question. Otherwise, I highly suggest Professor MacDonald.
Professor MacDonald really cares about your success in her class. She makes the lectures less boring with lots of demos. Also if you are in the honors discussion section, she brings cookies!

While psycholinguistics is pretty dry material, Professor MacDonald makes it much more tolerable. She is very kind, cares about her students, and genuinely WANTS us to succeed. Her exams are totally fair and the reading (while super boring) isn't too much. It's not exactly an "easy A" because you have put in some work, but its achievable with her!

Great professor if this is something you have interest in. Slides aren't put up so you have to go to class or ask someone. Test questions are straightforward from the assigned readings and lectures. One homework assignment, fairly easy.

Maryellen is a very nice lady who is very passionate about what she is teaching.  That being said, the lectures are somewhat boring as the topic is a very tedious subject.  The tests are fairly straightforward with about 90% multiple choice and 10% short answer.  One homework assignment that is a nice grade booster as long as you do it.
Personally, very boring class.  Not interested in the subject. Read the book. She's a good lecturer though and very nice. Passionate too.  Go to class!

Overall a decent professor. The first half of the class is really interesting - the rest is kind of boring and a bit too technical. She can sometimes brush over really important things without clarifying them, but you can tell she cares about the topic and her tests are fairly easy. Get ready to read - some questions on exam are from the book.

Class material was not that interesting, but she explained it well. Must read the book to fill in small gaps from lecture on test. Can be confusing material, but she helps clarify it. She can also be boring. 4 tests and a project.

Super nice woman, you can tell she tries to be the best professor she can be, very experienced and knowledgeable. Took the honors section for this class as well and she was very encouraging and helpful. A lot of reading, but manageable. Lectures are super clear, small extra credit opportunities, one big easy homework assignment that boosts grade.

Two things are essential to passing this class. 1) Go to lecture (slides NOT posted online) 2) read the textbook - questions are taken from both of these sources. If you do these two things, this class is super easy. Maryellen is a phenomenal professor who is clearly into what she's teaching. Plus her demos are pretty cool.

Maryellen is one of the best professors I've ever had. She does an amazing job at explaining information and really knows how to teach to students. He exams are exactly as she says they will be you just need to study and go to lecture. If you don't go to lecture don't expect to pass. She's extremely helpful and interested in her subject.

I did not study a lot because I wasn't interested in the subject in general, but still did okay compared to the effort I had put in. Even though people say it's an easy course, if you don't like the subject, it is hard to focus on studying.
She's way cool!  She helped me better understand my ADHD.
Nice professor. Lectures can get really long and boring as she likes to say the same thing fifty different ways. Tests are really fair. She gives good review sheets. Do the readings!
She was a great professor. Demos were interesting, tests were easy and she gave out really nice review sheets. read the book though, because a lot of questions came out of it...

Maryellen is pretty average. The class is super easy, as long as you go to the lectures you'll do well on her exams, short answers are often given in her practice exams so you end up knowing the answer ahead of time. Her lectures get boring, and she rambles on sometimes about things you don't need to know.

Certainly seemed to know her stuff as she was able to provide well-informed answers to student questions even when peripheral to the material and scope of the class. Tries to structure lectures to promote increased comprehension, but not always successful. Interesting topics. Tests are fair, and the single homework is an easy grade boost.

This class should be interesting, but the lectures ended up being very boring. She takes EVERY question, relevant or not, and it makes sitting through lecture very boring. Also, she takes too long to explain simple ideas and sometimes glosses over some that are more difficult to understand. Read the textbook. Very nice professor.

She is just OK. The material highly interested me, yet I still found myself losing focus in the lectures. She did not strike me as very competent. Exams are pretty much a breeze, and the homework is almost a joke it's so easy. Take it for the material, not the professor (in this case).

Professor MacDonald is unclear of what she knows and makes it obvious to the whole class.  She describes things over and over again that are clear and admits defeat for more complex ideas.  Including the specific area of her research.  It is boring and frustrating, a decent grade isn't hard to get but it is by no means worth it!

Very knowledgeable professor with loads of enthusiasm. Lectures are critical, demos are fun.  Exams have questions about demos.  Exams questions are fairly detailed, but if you study the lecture notes and textbook well, you will be fine.  Very detailed, interesting information in this class.  Uses many good examples to help comprehend the info.

Lecture notes are critical, especially since they aren't provided online at all.  Lectures do seem long because she seems to spend a lot of time on seemingly easy points and my sudoku skills have excelled because of this.  Decent class to take and probably one of the easiest psych classes I've taken.

Maryellen is so nice. She isn't too demanding, and tests you on the foundations/main points of what you're studying, which I think is great in a professor. She seems to value that you're understand what you're supposed to understand, as opposed to nit-picky, almost irrelevant details that you're sure to forget in a year anyway!

Exams a little on the difficult side but doesn't get too nit-picky. A lot of material is covered and the final is cumulative. She is a good lecturer, gets confused easily sometimes and stutters/mixes up words, can get boring and repetitive. In-class demos are fun, though.
lectures can be extremely boring.  she seems to waste a lot of time on demos.
I had this professor for Psych 413 and 483 and really enjoyed both classes.  You definitely need to pay attention in class and do the readings, but it's really interesting.

I really like to listen to her lecture, she always tries to bring in examples from real-life and tries to let us participate in trials so they we learn by doing. Interesting subject material and fun to listen to. Usually tests do not contain things from the reading that weren't at least mentioned in lecture.
No Comments
She's a very good professor. Speaks very well and with enthusiasm. Decently challenging class, a lot of information.
